c74object.name: sp.onsetframe~
c74object.digest: Amplitude-based onset detection and buffer~ recording
c74object.description: Amplitude-based onset detection and buffer~ recording.

discussion.p: The sp.onsetframe~ object takes audio input, just like sp.onset~ but instead of outputting just a bang/trigger/gate, it outputs the frame to start descriptor analysis. sp.onsetframe~ is useful when you want to analyze multiple descriptors and want them to all refer to the same exact analysis frame.

inlet.digest: SP Sensor or Contact Mic input
inlet.description: Audio input from an SP Sensor or Contact Mic to be used for onset detection.
Audio input from an air microphone when being used in different input modes.

outlet.digest: Sample position to beging analysis from
outlet.description: Sample position to analyze in rolling buffer~ along with buffer~ name.
Analyzed onset as a trigger, delay-compensated based on the current delay settings.
Analyzed onset as a gate, delay-compensated based on the current delay settings.

attribute.name: delay
attribute.digest: Amount of time to wait before sending frame to analyze
attribute.description: Amount of time to wait, in samples, before sending frame to analyze.

attribute.name: fastrampdown
attribute.digest: The number of samples the relative envelope follower will take to reach the next value when falling
attribute.description: The number of samples the relative envelope follower will take to reach the next value when falling. Typically, this will be faster than slowrampdown.

attribute.name: fastrampup
attribute.digest: The number of samples the relative envelope follower will take to reach the next value when raising
attribute.description: The number of samples the relative envelope follower will take to reach the next value when raising. Typically, this will be faster than slowrampup.

attribute.name: floor
attribute.digest: The level in dB the slow ramp needs to be above to consider a detected difference valid, allowing to ignore the onsets in the noise floor
attribute.description: The level in dB the slow ramp needs to be above to consider a detected difference valid, allowing to ignore the onsets in the noise floor.

attribute.name: highpassfreq
attribute.digest: The frequency of the fourth-order high-pass filter. This is done first on the signal to minimise low frequency intermodulation with very fast ramp lengths.
attribute.description: The frequency of the fourth-order Linkwitzâ€“Riley high-pass filter (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linkwitz%E2%80%93Riley_filter). This is done first on the signal to minimise low frequency intermodulation with very fast ramp lengths. A frequency of 0 bypasses the filter.

attribute.name: input
attribute.digest: Sets the mic input mode (SP Sensor, contact/trigger, air microphone)
attribute.description:
Sets the mic input mode allowing you to use an SP Sensor, a normal drum trigger/contact mic, or an air microphone. When using input modes 3/4, the SP sensor and contact mic are only used for onset detection, and the air microphone will be recorded into the buffer~ for audio analysis.
The available options are:
0 = SP sensor (default)
1 = drum trigger or contact mic
2 = air microphone
3 = SP sensor + air microphone
4 = drum trigger/contact mic + air microphone

attribute.name: lockout
attribute.digest: Amount of time (in ms) before it can get triggered again
attribute.description: Amount of time (in ms) before an onset can get triggered again.

attribute.name: minslicelength
attribute.digest: The length in samples that the slice will stay ON
attribute.description: The length in samples that the Slice will stay ON. Changes of states during that period will be ignored. This is the equivalent of lockout but set in samples.

attribute.name: offthreshold
attribute.digest: The threshold in dB of the relative envelope follower to reset, aka to allow the differential envelope to trigger again.
attribute.description: The threshold in dB of the relative envelope follower to reset, aka to allow the differential envelope to trigger again.

attribute.name: onthreshold
attribute.digest: The threshold in dB of the relative envelope follower to trigger an onset, aka to go ON when in OFF state
attribute.description: The threshold in dB of the relative envelope follower to trigger an onset, aka to go ON when in OFF state. It is computed on the difference between the two envelope followers.

attribute.name: sensitivity
attribute.digest: The nervousness of the algorithm thresholds (from 0 to 100%)
attribute.description: The nervousness of the algorithm thresholds (from 0 to 100%). This is essentially a 'macro' parameter for the individual on/off thresholds.

attribute.name: slowrampdown
attribute.digest: The number of samples the absolute envelope follower will take to reach the next value when falling.
attribute.description: The number of samples the absolute envelope follower will take to reach the next value when falling.

attribute.name: slowrampup
attribute.digest: The number of samples the absolute envelope follower will take to reach the next value when raising.
attribute.description: The number of samples the absolute envelope follower will take to reach the next value when raising.

attribute.name: threshold
attribute.digest: The level in dB to be above to consider a detected difference valid, allowing to ignore the onsets in the noise floor.
attribute.description: The level in dB to be above to consider a detected difference valid, allowing to ignore the onsets in the noise floor.
